page.title: 07NATURE RESERVE
page.content: ST ABBS NATURE RESERVE COVERS 240 ACRES . IT IS AN AREA OF OUTSTANDING NATURAL BEAUTY AND SCIENTIFIC INTEREST. THERE IS ONE FULL TIME WARDEN WHO IS EMPLOYED BY THE NATURE CONSERVANCY COUNCIL .THE CLIFFS ARE COMPOSED OF LAVA FROM AN ANCIENT VOLCANO AND THEY PROVIDE NESTING PLACES FOR THE THOUSANDS OF SEABIRDS WHICH THRONG THE PRECIPITOUS CLIFFS IN SPRING AND SUMMER . AMONGST THESE ARE KITTIWAKES, GUILLEMOTS, RAZORBILLS, SHAGS, FULMARS, HERRING AND LESSER BLACK-BACKED GULLS AND A SMALL NUMBER OF PUFFINS . ON THE INLAND AREAS WHEATEAR , SKYLARK, MEADOW PIPIT, STONCHAT AND YELLOWHAMMER ARE AMONG THE SPECIES WHICH BREED AMID THE GORSE AND WHIN . ON THE MIRE LOCH SOME OF THE INTERESTING NESTERS ARE GREBE MOORHEN COOT AND REED BUNTING.
